description.narrative: Optimise the technical capacity of the Guatemalan Attorney Office for the criminal investigation and strategic criminal prosecution, trough the transformation of the Management Case Model, the strengthening of the Human Rights Section and the specialised attention to Women, Indigenous Peoples and other vulnerable populations.

Guatemalas åklagarmyndighet har ansökt om medel från Sverige för finansiering av "Stärkande av teknisk kapacitet för strategisk brottsutredning från urfolkens perspektiv" under perioden 2015-2016.
Insatsen syftar till att: 1) Stödja en förändrad modell för utredning av fall i åtta åklagarkontor på distriktsnivå, 2) Konsolidera en särskilt fokus på urfolken genom ett utredningsverktyg för diskrimineringsfall, en dialogprocess med lokala ledare, certifierade tolkar i urfolkens språk, expertrapporter, 3) Konsolidering av bevis i paradigmatiska fall relaterade till den interna väpnade konflikten genom expertrapporter och fortbildning av åklagare, 4) Stärkande av dataplattformen SICOMP för förvaltning av brottsfall. Budgeten är på totalt 10 miljoner SEK och Sverige finansierar den totala summan.

The intervention is aimed to optimise the technical capacity of the Guatemalan Attorney Office for the criminal investigation and strategic criminal prosecution, trough the transformation of the Management Case Model, the strengthening of the Human Rights Section and the specialised attention to Women, Indigenous Peoples and other vulnerable populations

Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

description.narrative: In the case of Criminal Analysis Capacities, the Attorney General Office purchased and renewed the ArcGIS systems used for the identification of criminal patterns and hot spots, providing also statistics and intelligence information. This tool is widely used by other prosecutors authorities, creating the possibility to share and combine the information on criminal structures. Regarding Indigenous Peoples, the Attorney Office used the Swedish contribution to train prosecutors on the special attention to victims of indigenous peoples, with a emphasis in improving the knowledge on customary law. Also, the Guatemalan Attorney Office used the Swedish support to consolidate a strong relationship with several traditional authorities in the country. 21 specialized studies in the application of customary law in different regions of Guatemala were conducted as part of this result. The studies were uses as evidence for different cases under litigation. On regard of the litigation of emblematic Human Rights cases, the Swedish contribution was used to consolidate the evidence on at least 11 cases, including Molina Thyssen, Gerardi, AEU 89, Zamora Santos, Panzos, CNT, Achi, and others. At least 30 expert reports were conducted during the life of the program, with a special emphasis on the analysis of military, and military intelligence structures of the Guatemalan Army during the internal armed conflict. On regard of SICOMP, as this follow up system is unique in the Central American region, the upgrade and incorporation of new fields is a process made on a periodical basis. The report includes several mentions to the update of fields of SICOMP which were made because of the needs detected in the activities.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
